intro: Ceratostema colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian horned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Ceratostema colombianum is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique floral display.
